channel.title: Just bought a new pc
channel.description:
So Yea, Just ordered my new pc. Let me know what you guys think:
Processor (CPU) AMD PHENOM™ II X4 940 (3.0GHz) BLACK EDITION (Socket AM2+) Memory (RAM) 4GB CORSAIR XMS2 800MHz - LIFETIME WARRANTY! (2x2GB) Motherboard ASUS® M4N78: DUAL DDR2, S-ATA II, PCIe x16, 2 x PCIe x1, 3 x PCI Operating System Genuine Windows Vista™ Home Premium 64-bit + Windows 7 Upgrade Voucher (£85) USB Options 6 x USB 2.0 PORTS (4 REAR + 2 FRONT) AS STANDARD Memory - 1st Hard Disk 250GB SERIAL ATA 3-Gb/s HARD DRIVE WITH 8MB CACHE (7,200rpm) 2nd Hard Disk NONE RAID (HDD 1 & 2) NONE 1st CD/DVD Drive 22x DUAL LAYER LIGHTSCRIBE DVD WRITER ±R/±RW/RAM 2nd CD/DVD Drive NONE Graphics Card 896MB NVIDIA GEFORCE GTX260 PCI EXPRESS 2nd Graphics Card NONE Sound Card ONBOARD 8 CHANNEL (7.1) HIGH DEF AUDIO (AS STANDARD) Modem NONE, I WILL BE USING BROADBAND Network Facilities ONBOARD 10/100/1000 GIGABIT LAN PORT Floppy Disk Drive NONE Memory Card Reader INTERNAL 52 IN 1 CARD READER (READS XD, MS, CF, SD, etc) Case STYLISH SILVER/BLACK TRIDENT CASE + 2 FRONT USB Power Supply & Case Cooling 700W Quiet Quad Rail PSU + 120mm Case Fan (£58) Processor Cooling STANDARD CPU COOLER Firewire & Video Editing NONE TV Card NONE Monitor NONE 2nd Monitor NONE GeForce 3D Vision NONE DVI Cable NONE Keyboard & Mouse NONE Mouse NONE Speakers NONE Webcam NONE Headsets (VOIP) NONE Surge Protection NONE Printer NONE Anti-Virus NONE Office Software NONE External Hard Drive NONE Home Installation NONE Warranty 1 Year Return-to-Base incl 1st Month Free Collect & Return Delivery STANDARD INSURED DELIVERY TO UK MAINLAND (MON-FRI) Build Time Standard Build - Approximately 10 to 12 working days Price (excluding VAT) £536.52 Price £617.00 Order Quantity 1

item.title: Just bought a new pc
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

Why? I have a tv right next to my pc…[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 22, 2009, 02:41:14 pm[/size][hr]Received my new pc today… its awesome… Just need to put my old HD in and CD Drive and maybe the ram

Read full topic

item.title: Just bought a new pc
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

I take it you will be installing Windows 7 after it is released? If so, I see no harm in having Vista for the layover until Win7.

Read full topic

item.title: Just bought a new pc
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“The_Flames, post:16, topic:287571”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=380223.msg2858307#msg2858307 date=1247014936]

All for £620… Alot of money for me still got some left to go to london with lol.

Yeah, processor, RAM, and PSU are decent; nothing is off-brand. Looks like you got a deal, now install Linux.
[/quote]

I was about to say; If you install Linux then Vista won’t abuse your specs. That Windows 7 voucher will come in handy because apparently Win7 will be great for handling CPU & RAM usage.

Btw if you’re considering linux use Fedora 11 because I use and its pro++[/quote]Vista won’t abuse them cus he has good enough RAM.

Read full topic

item.title: Just bought a new pc
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

im stubburn so i dont wanna use linux lol

Read full topic

item.title: Just bought a new pc
item.dc:creator: @The_Flames The_Flames
item.description:
@The_Flames wrote:

[quote=“T4_, post:4, topic:287571”][quote author=TheBeanie link=topic=380223.msg2858302#msg2858302 date=1247014836]
All for £620… Alot of money for me still got some left to go to london with lol.
[/quote]
Yeah, processor, RAM, and PSU are decent; nothing is off-brand. Looks like you got a deal, now install Linux.[/quote]

I was about to say; If you install Linux then Vista won’t abuse your specs. That Windows 7 voucher will come in handy because apparently Win7 will be great for handling CPU & RAM usage.

Btw if you’re considering linux use Fedora 11 because I use and its pro++

Read full topic

[quote=“TheBeanie, post:12, topic:287571”]Update:
Bought this monitor:
LG W1952TQ

And:
SUPER QUIET 22dBA TRIPLE COPPER HEATPIPE CPU COOLER (£15) from STANDARD CPU COOLER[/quote]My cpu-fan is at 16dBA, it’s a Zalman though. Also costed about $80. It’s also completely free from sound when you turn it down with the included FanMate 2 controller

item.title: Just bought a new pc
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:8, topic:287571”][quote author=mwiebelhaus link=topic=380223.msg2858439#msg2858439 date=1247020659]

All for £620… Alot of money for me still got some left to go to london with lol.

Yeah, processor, RAM, and PSU are decent; nothing is off-brand. Looks like you got a deal, now install Linux.

Might as well take the video card back because you can’t do shit on Linux for games. Nothing that requires a graphics card that big.
[/quote]

Doom 3, Quake 4, Enemy Territory: Quake Wars and more than run natively. Then there are all of the Source engine games that run under WINE great.[/quote]
This. Take a look at http://appdb.winehq.org/objectManager.php?sClass=application&sTitle=Browse%20Applications&sOrderBy=appName&bAscending=true

Read full topic

item.title: Just bought a new pc
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

Speljohan:

I’d suggest replacing the PSU later, i bought a cooler master one for $100 aproximately, and it’s only 600W. I used to have a cheaper one, however they usually get very noisy after a small amount of time. Go with Cooler Master or Corsair. Other than that, very nice build. Similar to mine except i have the model cheaper CPU (200mhz difference), 8GB 1066mhz RAM and a GTX 275.

OR PC Power and Cooling. Their PSUs kick ass.

Read full topic

item.title: Just bought a new pc
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

I’d suggest replacing the PSU later, i bought a cooler master one for $100 aproximately, and it’s only 600W. I used to have a cheaper one, however they usually get very noisy after a small amount of time. Go with Cooler Master or Corsair. Other than that, very nice build. Similar to mine except i have the model cheaper CPU (200mhz difference), 8GB 1066mhz RAM and a GTX 275.
